suncertify.db
Class Data

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.Data
All Implemented Interfaces:
DBAccess
public class Data
extends java.lang.Object
implements DBAccess

This class implements the required DBAccess interface and is used by the BookingBusinessLodgicImp class and possibly other applications to preform their database operations.
It uses two worker classes DatabaseFileAccess and the RecordLockingManager to preform its functions through their methods.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Robert Black

Constructor Summary
Data()

All instances of this class share the same static DatabaseFileAccess and RecordLockingManager.

Constructor Detail

Data

public Data()
     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
            java.io.IOException
The default constructor that creates a class which implements the DBAcess interface, used to access the database.

All instances of this class share the same static DatabaseFileAccess and RecordLockingManager.

Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the database file cannot be found.
java.io.IOException - if the database file cannot be read or written to.

public java.lang.String[] readRecord(long recNo)
                              throws RecordNotFoundException
Reads a record from the file. Returns an array where each element is a record value.

Specified by:
readRecord in interface DBAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the record number (file position).
Returns:
a String[] array containing the records field data.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record is deleted or doesn't exist.

updateRecord

public void updateRecord(long recNo,
                         java.lang.String[] data,
                         long lockCookie)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         SecurityException
Modifies the fields of a record. The new value for field n appears in data[n].

Specified by:
updateRecord in interface DBAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the record number (file position).
data - the array containing the updated data.
lockCookie - the cookie obtained from lockRecord(long recNo) from RecordLockingManager.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record is deleted or doesn't exist.
SecurityException - if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie.

findByCriteria

public long[] findByCriteria(java.lang.String[] criteria)
Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".

Specified by:
findByCriteria in interface DBAccess
Parameters:
criteria - an String[] containing the data to match.
Returns:
an long[] with matching record numbers (file positions).

createRecord

public long createRecord(java.lang.String[] data)
                  throws DuplicateKeyException
Creates a new record in the database (reusing a deleted entry). Inserts the given data, and returns the record number of the new record.

Specified by:
createRecord in interface DBAccess
Parameters:
data - an String[] containing the data for a new record.
Returns:
the new record number (file position).
Throws:
DuplicateKeyException - if a record that matches the primary key (name and location fields) of an existing record.

lockRecord

public long lockRecord(long recNo)
                throws RecordNotFoundException
Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. If the specified record is already locked by a different client, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.

Specified by:
lockRecord in interface DBAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the record number (file position).
Returns:
is a cookie that must be used when the record is unlocked, updated, or deleted.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record is deleted or doesn't exist.

unlock

public void unlock(long recNo,
                   long cookie)
            throws SecurityException
Releases the lock on a record. Cookie must be the cookie returned when the record was locked.

Specified by:
unlock in interface DBAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the record number (file position).
cookie - the cookie obtained from lockRecord(long recNo) from RecordLockingManager.
Throws:
SecurityException - if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie.
